content.raw: Right, you can't reorder anything in the initializer list, but the compiler will throw a warning if you try to put anything in the initializer list in the wrong order. So 1. you get to see during construction what order everything is being constructed in (which might not be obvious in a header where everything can be spread out), and 2. if your expectation about what order things are being initialized in is wrong, the compiler will warn you about it (although I'd prefer it throw a compilation error, but I'll take what I can get).
content.html: Right, you can't reorder anything in the initializer list, but the compiler will throw a warning if you try to put anything in the initializer list in the wrong order. So 1. you get to see during construction what order everything is being constructed in (which might not be obvious in a header where everything can be spread out), and 2. if your expectation about what order things are being initialized in is wrong, the compiler will warn you about it (although I'd prefer it throw a compilation error, but I'll take what I can get).
